meanings.definition: Moving in a twisting or contorted manner
meanings.sent1: The snake was wrigglier than the worm.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar became wrigglier as it tried to escape.
meanings.sent3: The dance floor was filled with wrigglier moves than a bowl of spaghetti.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses became wrigglier as she tried to avoid the truth.
meanings.sent5: The river took a wrigglier path through the forest, like a serpent slithering through the trees.

meanings.definition: More inclined to wriggle or squirm
meanings.sent1: The toddler was wrigglier than a bag of eels during diaper changes.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was getting wrigglier as it wanted to play.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked wrigglier than a fish out of water when trying to escape the bath.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was wrigglier than a worm on a hook when tickled.
meanings.sent5: The excitement made the children even wrigglier than a bunch of squirmy worms in a jar.
